title: Unicode Comments
content: Besides ``//``, ``#``, ``/** */`` and ``/* */``, there is another way to make a comment in PHP: unicode #️⃣️ . This is possible as this unicode character is build on top of 3 codepoints: among those, the first one is ``#``, which is an actual comment character. Then, PHP parses it as a single bytes, and interprets it as a comment: the rest of the line is omitted.
author: Aken Roberts
